title: Pelucones
text: Pelucones (<a href="spanish%20language">Spanish</a> for bigwigs) was the name used to refer to Chilean <a href="aristocracy">aristocratic</a> <a href="conservative">conservative</a>s in early 19th century. The name "Pelucones" was originally used by the "<a href="Pipiolos">Pipiolos</a>", or Liberals, as a derogatory term linking the conservatives to old fashioned <a href="wig">wig</a>s that were popular in the 18th century. Following the <a href="Chilean%20Civil%20War%20of%201829">Chilean Civil War of 1829</a>, when the "Pipiolos" were defeated, the "Pelucones" enforced the <a href="Chilean%20Constitution%20of%201833">Chilean Constitution of 1833</a>. This led to creation of a strong <a href="unitary%20state">unitary</a>, <a href="authoritarian">authoritarian</a> and <a href="presidentialist">presidentialist</a> system supported and maintained by the upper classes.
